result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlz Whitney Strong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charlz Whitney Strong

records.addlTxt:
3:55 PM Defendant Charlz Whitney Strong in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Charlz Whitney Strong.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties indicate that an agreement has been reached. Court has reviewed State's sentencing memorandum. State recites agreement. 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of extended supervision. 133 days of sentence credit. Sentence will run concurrent to MN case files. Conditions to include programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, payment of court costs, and continuation of no contact with the Victim's mother. Defendant is not eligible for either programing options. State is in compliance with Victim's rights. 
Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Nelsen stipulates to a factual basis. Court finds that the defendant's pleas have been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court accepts the defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty. State makes a statement regarding sentencing, asks Court to accept agreement. Attorney Nelsen makes a statement regarding sentencing, asks Court to accept joint recommendation.
Court orders 4 years of initial confinement followed by 4 years of extended supervision. Sentence will run concurrent to MN case files 69DU-CR-20-3592 and 69DU-CR-21-2927. 133 days of sentence credit. Conditions to include programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, payment of court costs, and continuation of no contact with the Victim's mother. Defendant is not eligible for either programing options.

8:39 AM Defendant Charlz Whitney Strong in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Charlz Whitney Strong.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledge receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea. Asks for trial.
Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:48 PM Defendant Charlz Whitney Strong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman appears via video appearance on behalf of the defendant. Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint and waives reading. Attorney Hoffman indicates that the defendant is at the jail on a hold from an interstate agreement. State asks for $100,000 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of drugs. Notes that the defendant is currently serving a prison sentence in MN and has release date of 2024. State indicates that the defendant has allegations of escapes from incarceration and recites prior criminal history. Attorney Hoffman notes that there is no objection to bond due to his hold from MN DOC. Court orders $100,000 cash bond with conditions of no use or possession of drugs or paraphernalia. Court quashes warrant.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
